unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Describing the Distribution
question_text:
A local police officer gives out between $1$ and $6\text{ tickets a day}$, the probability distribution table of which is shown above, where $X$ is the number of tickets handed out on any given day.
One can describe this distribution as...
tables:
X123456
P(X)0.040.110.330.350.140.03

choices.text: Approximately normal, with a center of $3.5$.
A distribution with a center of about $3.5$, but describing the distribution using shape does not make sense in this situation.
Uniform with a center of $3$ or $4$; one must give integer values for center since a police officer cannot give out a non-integer amount of tickets on a given day.
Approximately normal, with a center of $3$ or $4$; one must give integer values for center since a police officer cannot give out a non-integer amount of tickets on a given day.

solution:
When drawing a histogram, the center is the point where approximately half of the area is to the left, and approximately half of the area is to the right. This corresponds to a value of near 3.5. The center can be a non-integer.

The shape, when graphed, will be approximately normal. No real-life data is perfectly normal, so the word “approximately” or some similar word must be used in front of it.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
